alert.note: Alert for Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 4:30AM EDT until July 29 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 AM EDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Kentucky, including the following counties, Johnson and Martin. * WHEN...Until 830 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 428 AM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring. - Law enforcement reported that water levels are slowly beginning to recede. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Inez, Warfield, Debord, Pevier, Delong, Tomahawk, Davella, Stidham, Preece, Davisport, Bradbury, Wells, Prince, Add, Milo, Andy, Job, Calf Creek, Lovely and Beauty.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
